string-array.name: pokemon_facts
string-array.item: The term "Pokémon" is short for "Pocket Monsters" in Japanese.
Early script drafts of the film show that the character of Detective Pikachu was originally planned to be a Dewott.
When creating the species, Atsuko Nishida was told to make a creature that was cute, yellow, and had electricity powers.
In the first few seconds of the Japanese Pokémon opening, \'Mezase Pokémon Masutā\', a Clefairy is seen following Ash, with a Pikachu walking behind it.
Pikachu\'s design was based on a squirrel, not a mouse as commonly believed.
Bulbasaur\'s design is a blend of a dinosaur and a plant, symbolizing the game\'s theme of harmony between nature and creatures.
Teachers have used Pokémon to teach subjects like math, reading, and social skills, utilizing its popularity to engage students.
Some Pokémon trading cards are extremely rare and can sell for thousands of dollars at auctions.
Weedle is the only Pokémon that can\'t learn normal-type moves.
The patterns on Arbok\'s chest vary depending on which region it\'s from.
Meowth is the only Pokémon with more than one regional form.
Despite not being a legendary Pokémon, Arcanine still bears the title of one.
